website_summaries.verdict: A strong and high-quality option for shore or bank fishing.
pros: Lightweight holder is easy to carry and store
Holds two poles (three in a pinch)
Inserts into soft banks or along shores easily
cons: Rods just lean against the holder arms, which may be a problem when large fish take your bait
May need to use bungee cords or straps to better secure the poles
Holder is a little difficult to push into hard ground

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Big Clumsy
customer_reviews.text: These products arrived as Christmas presents to our three boys (bought 3). Incredible value and heavy gauge for the price. The only reason for 4 versus 5 stars is that they are large and a bit heavy to move around. While this would typically be a good thing, their size and weight make them a little less likely to drag along each time you go fishing. Don't let this deter you from these if not a concern, because the quality/value is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: The right holder for me!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rod holder! It is strong, durable, and just the right height. I used a pipe wrench to slightly straighten the middle prongs to hold a 3rd rod securely.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Preston

customer_reviews.title: More than just a bank fishing double rod stand if you do as I do. Please read....
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best fishing rod stands I’ve ever used. With two as I’ve have for a few years before buying this new one, I set up two of these and am able to rest my poles of nearly any typical length parallel to the ground and water just like this much more expensive European carp style bank rod rack costing at least $60. Here’s a photo of two of these holders in use as I’ve described.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. Broke on me after only a dozen uses or so. The welds broke on bottom. Plus nothing holds the bottom of your rod, so the minute u get a bite your whole pole flies up and over leaving u to chase it down to catch it and your fish.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Vardeman

customer_reviews.title: Great holder, one flaw
customer_reviews.text: I took this fishing today and hooked a large channel catfish. I didn’t have a bell on the rod, and wasn’t paying attention. When the fish grabbed the bait and swam off, it nearly took my rod and reel with it! The design of the holder is great, sturdy, and handy to use. But if you a bite on a large aggressive fish, this thing acts like the fulcrum on a teeter totter and your rod may go for a swim! I recommend figuring out a simple way to further secure your rod and reel when using this holder. Otherwise, it’s a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this rod holder
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rod holder! It's fantastic when going catfish or carp fishing where you often wait for some action. Very high quality and easy to put into the ground. Highly recommend for shore fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats using a V-shaped stick by a long shot!
customer_reviews.text: I plan on getting a lot of use with my new holder. In fact, I just went out yesterday and bought a 2nd rod & reel!
customer_reviews.author: jim steele sr.

customer_reviews.title: Been using for 1 year now
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for a year or so now. Buying another one today. This second one will be used for baiting and setting up other poles while my older one holds the poles in the water. Kids coming of age so more poles to work with. PS. Not sure how someone said this broke on him in another comment. It's sturdy as can be. We fish for the big ones too! Biggest one got away though.
customer_reviews.author: Right Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Holds fishing pole very well.
customer_reviews.text: Holds poles well, at the right height. Mig welded solid assembly. Hard to push/force bottom prongs into soil ( depends IF rocky, clay or sand ). I used a hammer & an 80 penny nail per spike hole. Worked nicely. Used lantern shield. 5-A product. Recommend !
customer_reviews.author: T.  P.  S.                ••••• 😁 ((  RetiredWelder  )) 😁 •••••

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he loves it. It's very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: The item name says it all!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pole stand. It is just the right height and I can actually say my pole isn't going to go anywhere if I'm not paying attention. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: kiml

customer_reviews.title: Greatest thing since sliced bread!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these years ago from Cabela. I left both laying at the river and lost them, they don't carry them anymore. Glad I found them on Amazon!! Greatest thing since sliced bread for bank fishing!! Pic was a few years ago with the original set.
customer_reviews.author: HiTech Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This rod holder is amazing. It is very strong and has a nice grippy feeling to it. Definitely recommend this product. Can hold up to 3 rods.
customer_reviews.author: JohnV

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: push them in the dirt and there you are, pole holders. works very well
customer_reviews.author: C.R.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great invention
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, it holds two poles and sets up easily. Any bank fisherman would be pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: John Steinbeck "Lee"

customer_reviews.title: Get before they are gone..
customer_reviews.text: Very well build and sturdy. i am sure this will last a long time. will do an exceleent job for serious bank fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is nicely made. It is advertised as a two pole holder, but is easily used with three.
customer_reviews.author: P. D. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent.
customer_reviews.text: Received on time and well packaged. Appears strong and suitable enough for use on river and banks that aren't too rocky. Will put to the test soon and update.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Rod holder for 2 rods
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. A little odd to carry but serves purpose fine
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto.
customer_reviews.text: I drilled a couple holes in my pier and set it in there. It is awesome. Saves a lot of bending over.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Father's Day gift and my husband really loves it. I was on the fence about spending 20$ but even he said it was well worth the price. Very stable, holds rods even with aggressive bites, easy to set hooks. Well built.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, but does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job at what it is designed to do, but only got 4 stars because it is over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works great
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. Was able to use 3 poles due to the top tabs location.
customer_reviews.author: GW COF

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product, so much easier than finding a stick that will actually work, particularly with hard/rocky banks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, i had a 30 pound gar on my pole and this rod holder took it like a champ
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well built, durable. Not very compact but well worth the bulk if you have room.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Machamer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: fast shipping but sorry I purchased so quick found the same thing for cheaper on another site.
customer_reviews.author: John Dobbins

customer_reviews.title: Helps see the action.
customer_reviews.text: Really gets the rods off of the ground where you can better see the hitting action of the fish. Best I've seen and used.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Be near to get rods. Otherwise u might lose one to a big fish
customer_reviews.author: LollyGags

customer_reviews.title: Scratched everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriends birthday. This quality doesn’t seem accurate for the price. All of the areas colored in yellow were scratched in some way. Not sure if that was due to transit issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Edwards

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m really happy with this rod holder; I wish it was about 6 inches wider but it’s great to use at pay lakes or over crowded fishing spots.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Bulmer

customer_reviews.title: They are great
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd one but 1 got stolen on me I love them they have save a couple poles too! everyone I've come across has asked me where I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very well made. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to fishing and have lost a rod and reel to a fish dragging it into the water. This holds the rod in place and will prevent a repeat of my unfortunate accident.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing pole holder ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have used several fishing pole holders over the years but this was the best one by far!
customer_reviews.author: Cutshall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent been looking for a rod holder like this for years
customer_reviews.author: bruce jake perry

customer_reviews.title: Love the holder
customer_reviews.text: Love the holder. Better than other rod holders that stick individually into the ground. Planning on re-ordering more for Father's Day.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: It's solid don't have to worry about being broken.
customer_reviews.text: Good piece to have when you go fishing. Don't have to worry about laying it down anywhere. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Janjeffjones9499

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Don't have to worry about my rods getting taken into the water. Any fisherman has seen or had that happen once in there lives.
customer_reviews.author: jose f.

customer_reviews.title: Had the basement a little wider so my foot could get through more easily and it was a little more substantial in that ...
customer_reviews.text: *Christine's husband here* I used it on several fishing trips and it worked well. What's keeping it from five stars is it's a little difficult in hard ground to push it in. Had the basement a little wider so my foot could get through more easily and it was a little more substantial in that area so that I wasn't concerned about breaking the weld, which did not happen, I would have given it a five-star rating. Overall I am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for me own two will be buying two more for friend
customer_reviews.author: Joel Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great for fishing from bank
customer_reviews.text: Great for bank fishing. Seem sturdy. Easy to move if needed. You can easily put three rods on these the way they are made.
customer_reviews.author: kindlelover

product_meta.title: RITE-HITE Bank Fishing Dual-Rod Holder - Holds Two Fishing Rods and Reels at The Optimum Angle. Great for Bank Fishing on Lakes and Streams
feature_bullets: Great for Bank Fishing, Lakes, Ponds and Streams
Secure 2 Rods & Reels and a Lantern for Night Fishing
Sturdy Steel Construction and a Rust Proof Powder-Coated Finish Ensures You'll Be Using it for Many Season To Come
Soft Cushioned Cradles to Protect your Rods Finish. Stores Flat for Easy Transport and Storage
